GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Abnormal C1 Esterase Inhibitor

C1 inhibitor levels are reduced in cases of hereditary angioedema. In this condition, 85% of patients will have decreased antigenic and functional C1 inhibitor levels, whereas 15% will have a dysfunctional protein.
Abnormal C1Q and C1 Esterase Inhibitor
Blood test showed low C1Q and low or dysfunctional C1 Inhibitor.
ACE Inhibitor detected in blood test
Blood test has revealed ACE Inhibitors in the blood and a normal C1 Inhibitor level.
Abnormal PBG in urine
A raised urine porphobilinogen (PBG) is suggestive of an acute attack of porphyria.
Naeglearia Fowleri Detected
CSF Analysis has found the free-living amoeba Naegleria Fowleri causing Meningoencephalitis.
Capillary leakage findings

Evaluation of symtoms including Arterial hypotension, hemoconcentration and hypoalbuminemia in absence of secondary causes of shock and infection indicates Clarksons Disease (Idiopathic Capillary Leak Syndrome).
Wilsons Disease findings
Liver biopsy showing more than 250 ug/g of dried liver tissue confirms wilsons disease.
High muscle compartment pressure
Manometer readings of >30 mmHg in the muscle compartment is consistant with compartment syndrome and is at risk of ischemic necrosis.
Gene identified
Genetic testing reveals a mutation in the npc1/npc2 gene.
Multiple Gastrinoma
MRI has revealed multiple gastrinoma in the pancreas
Menetriers biopsy findings
Mucosal biopsy taken during endoscopy is consistant with menetriers disease.
Abnormal Esophageal motility
Esophageal manometry shows abnormal motility consistant with achalasia.
MALS findings in Echocardiograph
Doppler ultrasonography measuring peak systolic velocities greater than 200cm/s in the celiac artery are suggestive of celiac artery stenosis associated with MALS.
Bouveret Syndrome findings on CT
CT scan has revealed presence of a bilioduodenal fistula that has gastric outlet obstruction.
Excessive Heart rate increase
An active stand test found an increase in heart rate greater than 30 beats per minute.
Abnormal Liver Ultrasound
Liver ultrasound reveals significant damage to hepatic veins with signs of thrombosis and/or stenosis.
Gene identified
Genetic testing has revealed abnormalities in GP1BA, GP1BB and GP9 genes.
Evans Syndrome findings
CBC testing revealed the presence of both hemolytic anemia and immune thrombocytopenic purpura with a positive coombs test suggestive of Evans syndrome.
ADEM findings on MRI
MRI revealed multifocal demyelinating lesions in the brain suggestive of ADEM.
Gene identified
Genetic testing reveals abnormalities in the PKHD1 gene.
Rucurrent Ulcers
Clinical evaluation of recurrent ulcers on mouth and genitals along with an elevated crp suggests behcets disease.
Gene identified
Genetic testing revealed abnormalities in the BTD gene.
